name: twingate
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing twingate cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`twingate` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing twingate cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/pulumi-twingate/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/pulumi-twingate/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-twingate` repo](https://github.com/Twingate/terraform-provider-twingate/issues).

apiToken.description:
The access key for API operations. You can retrieve this from the Twingate Admin Console
([documentation](https://docs.twingate.com/docs/api-overview)). Alternatively, this can be specified using the
TWINGATE_API_TOKEN environment variable.

httpMaxRetry.description:
Specifies a retry limit for the http requests made. The default value is 10. Alternatively, this can be specified using
the TWINGATE_HTTP_MAX_RETRY environment variable

httpTimeout.description:
Specifies a time limit in seconds for the http requests made. The default value is 10 seconds. Alternatively, this can
be specified using the TWINGATE_HTTP_TIMEOUT environment variable

network.description:
Your Twingate network ID for API operations. You can find it in the Admin Console URL, for example:
`autoco.twingate.com`, where `autoco` is your network ID Alternatively, this can be specified using the TWINGATE_NETWORK
environment variable.

url.description: The default is 'twingate.com' This is optional and shouldn't be changed under normal circumstances.

groupIds.description: List of Group IDs that will have permission to access the Resource.

serviceAccountIds.description: List of Service Account IDs that will have permission to access the Resource.

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

id.description: The ID of the Connector.

name.description: The Name of the Connector.

remoteNetworkId.description: The ID of the Remote Network attached to the Connector.

statusUpdatesEnabled.description: Determines whether status notifications are enabled for the Connector.

id.description: The ID of the Group

isActive.description: Indicates if the Group is active

name.description: The name of the Group

securityPolicyId.description: The Security Policy assigned to the Group.

id.description: The ID of the Remote Network

location.description: The location of the Remote Network. Must be one of the following: AWS, AZURE, GOOGLE*CLOUD, ON*PREMISE, OTHER.

name.description: The name of the Remote Network

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

address.description: The Resource's IP/CIDR or FQDN/DNS zone

id.description: The id of the Resource

name.description: The name of the Resource

protocols.description: Restrict access to certain protocols and ports. By default or when this argument is not defined, there is no restriction, and all protocols and ports are allowed.

remoteNetworkId.description: Remote Network ID where the Resource lives

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

policy.description: Whether to allow or deny all ports, or restrict protocol access within certain port ranges: Can be `RESTRICTED` (only listed ports are allowed), `ALLOW_ALL`, or `DENY_ALL`

ports.description: List of port ranges between 1 and 65535 inclusive, in the format `100-200` for a range, or `8080` for a single port

id.description: Return a matching Security Policy by its ID. The ID for the Security Policy can be obtained from the Admin API or the URL string in the Admin Console.

name.description: Return a Security Policy that exactly matches this name.

id.description: ID of the Service Account resource

keyIds.description: List of twingate*service*account_key IDs that are assigned to the Service Account.

name.description: Name of the Service Account

resourceIds.description: List of twingate.TwingateResource IDs that the Service Account is assigned to.

email.description: The email address of the User

firstName.description: The first name of the User

id.description: The ID of the User

isAdmin.description: Indicates whether the User is an admin
isAdmin.deprecationMessage: This read-only Boolean value will be deprecated in a future release. You may use the `role` value instead.

lastName.description: The last name of the User

role.description: Indicates the User's role. Either ADMIN, DEVOPS, SUPPORT, or MEMBER.

type.description: Indicates the User's type. Either MANUAL or SYNCED.

provider.description:
The provider type for the twingate package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apiToken.description:
The access key for API operations. You can retrieve this from the Twingate Admin Console
([documentation](https://docs.twingate.com/docs/api-overview)). Alternatively, this can be specified using the
TWINGATE_API_TOKEN environment variable.

httpMaxRetry.description:
Specifies a retry limit for the http requests made. The default value is 10. Alternatively, this can be specified using
the TWINGATE_HTTP_MAX_RETRY environment variable

httpTimeout.description:
Specifies a time limit in seconds for the http requests made. The default value is 10 seconds. Alternatively, this can
be specified using the TWINGATE_HTTP_TIMEOUT environment variable

network.description:
Your Twingate network ID for API operations. You can find it in the Admin Console URL, for example:
`autoco.twingate.com`, where `autoco` is your network ID Alternatively, this can be specified using the TWINGATE_NETWORK
environment variable.

isAuthoritative.description:
Determines whether User assignments to this Group will override any existing assignments. Default is `true`. If set to
`false`, assignments made outside of Terraform will be ignored.

name.description: The name of the group

securityPolicyId.description: Defines which Security Policy applies to this Group. The Security Policy ID can be obtained from the `twingate.getTwingateSecurityPolicy` and `twingate.getTwingateSecurityPolicies` data sources.

userIds.description: List of User IDs that have permission to access the Group.

role.description: Determines the User's role. Either ADMIN, DEVOPS, SUPPORT or MEMBER.

sendInvite.description: Determines whether to send an email invitation to the User. True by default.
